SEARCH
Package gw.api.heatmap

Class HeatMapDataSet

java.lang.Object
gw.api.heatmap.HeatMapDataSet
public abstract class HeatMapDataSet extends Object
Base class for data sets on the heat map. To use:
  • (optional) extend LatLong to add additional data fields
  • Implement heatMapQuery()
  • (optional) override filter() to conditionally include points in MapPoints
  • (optional) override getWeight() to give map points values other than 1
  • (optional) If you're using a heat map cache (extending from HeatMapCacheBase), override MapPoints to return mapPointQuery().
  • Include the data set in a call to HeatMapGenerator.setDataSets(HeatMapDataSet... dataSets)
Author:
jfehrle

    • setColorMap

      Parameters:

    • getWeight

      public int getWeight(LatLong mapPoint)
      Returns the weight to apply for the specified map point. The base method returns 1, which produces a map that counts the number of points. To create a map that shows money amounts, override this method to return the amount associated with this point. The weight should always be >= 0.

      Note: Internally the weights are summed for each pixel using 32 bit integers. The summing code is overflow-safe; if the sum exceeds the maximum integer value ((2^31)-1), the sum is set to the maximum value. For color mapping, if the range for any color would exceed the maximum value, divide the weight and color range by an appropriate constant. For example, if there is a range of 9 to 10 trillion yen, dividing the weight and color range by 10000 will give the expected result.

      Parameters:
      mapPoint - The point.
      Returns:
      The weight.

    • getMapPoints

      public List<LatLong> getMapPoints()
      The list of points to display in the map. If the map point data has timed out (see MapPointsTimeout), upon receiving a new request for map overlay tiles, HeatMapGenerator will re-run the query (mapPointQuery()).
      Returns:
      The list of points to display on the map.

      @Deprecated public void setMapPoints(List<LatLong> mapPoints)

      Set the list of points to display in the map. If the map point data has timed out (see MapPointsTimeout), upon receiving a new request for map overlay tiles, HeatMapGenerator will re-run the query (mapPointQuery()).
      Parameters:
      mapPoints - the list of points to display on the map

    • clearMapPoints

      Clear the mapPoints array, e.g. upon buffer timeout

    • getSumOfSelectedPoints

      public long getSumOfSelectedPoints()
      The sum of the weights of the selected points based on the selected rectange. Call computeCountOfPointsSelected() to compute this total.
      Returns:
      The sum of the weights for the selected points.

    • getCountOfPointsSelected

      public int getCountOfPointsSelected()
      The number of points inside the selected rectangle specified by setSelection().
      Returns:
      The number of points in the specified region.

    • computeCountOfPointsSelected

      @Deprecated public int computeCountOfPointsSelected()
      Deprecated.
      Computes the number of points selected based and the sum of their weights on the selected rectangle, set with setRectangularSelection(). Call getSumOfSelectedPoints() to get the sum of the weights.
      Returns:
      The number of points in the specified region.

    • generateSelectedSetOfPoints

      public ArrayList<LatLong> generateSelectedSetOfPoints(LatLong selectedPoint1, LatLong selectedPoint2)
      Generate a list of map points that are in the selected area of the map. The second selection point is always considered east of the first selection point to allow for selection areas that span the international date line. For example, the selection points (0, 0), (1, 1) indicate a 1 degree span of latitude and longitude. Reversing the points as (1, 1), (0,0) indicates 359 degrees of longitude and 1 degree of latitude.
      Parameters:
      selectedPoint1 - A western corner of the selected rectangle
      selectedPoint2 - An eastern corner of the selected rectangle
      Returns:
      The list of selected points.

    • filter

      public boolean filter(LatLong point)
      Override this method to filter map points from MapPoints. If the method returns true, the point is included in heatmap processing; if false, the point is ignored by the heatmap. This allows MapPoints to be shared among multiple sessions with separate filter conditions for each.

      The default method always returns true.

      Parameters:
      point - a point in MapPoints
      Returns:
      true to include

    • mapPointQuery

      public abstract List<LatLong> mapPointQuery()
      Abstract method for loading the map points from the database (or elsewhere). HeatMapGenerator will call this method when needed. If a user pans or zooms the map after the map point data has timed out, HeatMapGenerator will repeat the query.
      Returns:
      The list of points.
